docs.lead_paragraph: Randy Brogdon, chairman of the Oklahoma Republican Party, apologized Tuesday for a post on the party’s Facebook page that said that giving people food stamps was akin to feeding animals in national parks.

headline.main: Oklahoma: G.O.P. Leader Apologizes for Insult to Food Stamp Recipients
headline.print_headline: Oklahoma: G.O.P. Leader Apologizes for Insult to Food Stamp Recipients

docs.abstract: Oklahoma Republican Party chairman Randy Brogdon apologizes for post on party's Facebook page that likened food stamp recipients to animals in public parks.
docs.snippet: Randy Brogdon, chairman of the Oklahoma Republican Party, apologized Tuesday for a post on the party’s Facebook page that said that giving people food stamps was akin to feeding animals in national parks.

docs.lead_paragraph: The winners of the national challenge had been asked to come up with original recipes that were affordable, delicious and met nutritional guidelines.

headline.main: White House Lunch Features Healthy Recipes by Young Chefs

docs.abstract: Healthy Lunchtime Challenge, created by Cooking Up Big Dreams chief executive Tanya Steel, invites young chefs to enter healthy recipe contest and rewards winners with White House dinner featuring their recipes.
docs.snippet: The winners of the national challenge had been asked to come up with original recipes that were affordable, delicious and met nutritional guidelines.
